Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix3 API: changes from Heritrix2
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=vCjQbx3WittwPbrECPUxusBSFBtZJwVHqYtG4Aysy6YF
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Joost Ouwerkerk wrote:
> We need to adapt a custom Processor written for Heritrix2 to work with 
> Heritrix3.  Is there any documentation about the API differences?

No formal docs yet, sorry. The main changes to be concerned with are:

(1) All configuration should now occur via getters/setters that fit the 
'bean properties' pattern (rather than the introspected static Key 
values of H2).

(2) Processors always act on an instance of CrawlURI (rather than 
ProcessorURI).

(3) Depending on when your processor should run, it may now belong in 
either the 'fetch chain', the 'disposition chain', or (less likely for a 
forward-ported processor) the 'candidates chain', and the neighboring 
processors you position it relative to in your configuration may have 
been renamed.

(4) If the processor keeps its own running state that should be saved 
along with a crawl checkpoint, it should implement a toCheckpointJson() 
  like those implementations that already exist. (If the precision of 
such state across checkpoint-restarts is crucial, the processor belongs 
in the disposition chain rather than the fetch chain. If the processor 
has more complicated data structures, such as its own on-disk database, 
it may need a more involved doCheckpoint() method; BdbModule provides 
one example of such a method with regard to a BerkeleyDB-JE environment.)

I suggest finding the bundled Processor most similar in intent to yours, 
and comparing its changes from H2 to H3 as a rough guide to porting.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA
